question:
You're attracted to someone who you know is in a committed relationship. What do you do?

Choices:
 (A) I flirt anyway - their relationship isn't my problem
 (B) I maintain appropriate boundaries and respect their commitment

Your partner is away and an attractive coworker explicitly shows romantic interest. How do you respond?

Choices:
 (A) I engage in flirting - it's harmless if nothing physical happens
 (B) I mention my partner and keep things platonic

You match with someone online who clearly states they only want something casual while you want a relationship. What do you do?

Choices:
 (A) I go along with it hoping they'll change their mind
 (B) I communicate my boundaries and move on if incompatible

You notice a coworker's physical attractiveness during a professional meeting. How do you proceed?

Choices:
 (A) I make suggestive comments and test their interest
 (B) I maintain professional behavior regardless of attraction

Your friend confides their relationship troubles to you. You've always found them attractive. What's your move?

Choices:
 (A) I subtly position myself as the better alternative
 (B) I offer support without any ulterior motives

You're at a party and someone is clearly intoxicated and making advances toward you. What do you do?

Choices:
 (A) I take advantage of their lowered inhibitions
 (B) I help them get home safely without any advances

You accidentally discover your friend's partner has an active dating profile. How do you handle it?

Choices:
 (A) I match with them to see what happens
 (B) I inform my friend about what I found

Someone sends you explicit photos you didn't ask for or want. What's your response?

Choices:
 (A) I save them and share with friends for entertainment
 (B) I delete them and set clear boundaries

You're in a committed relationship but develop genuine feelings for someone else you see regularly. What do you do?

Choices:
 (A) I pursue both to see which works out better
 (B) I create distance from the other person and work on my relationship

An ex reaches out late at night with clearly suggestive messages while you're in a new relationship. How do you respond?

Choices:
 (A) I engage - we have history so it's natural
 (B) I don't respond or I set a clear boundary

Your massage therapist is attractive. During the session, your mind wanders. Your thought?

Choices:
 (A) A little fantasy never hurt anyone - they probably get this all the time anyway
 (B) This is a professional setting - I need to respect boundaries even in my thoughts

Your ex drunk texts you at 2 AM saying they miss you. You're lonely. Your impulse?

Choices:
 (A) We both know what this is - no one has to get hurt if we're careful
 (B) This would complicate everything - I'm deleting this and going to sleep

At the gym, someone in great shape is working out near you. Your internal response?

Choices:
 (A) I'll position myself for a better view - looking is free and harmless
 (B) They're just trying to exercise - I'll focus on my own workout

Your attractive neighbor asks for help moving furniture. They're home alone. Your thought?

Choices:
 (A) This is like the start of those videos - maybe something will happen
 (B) They need help with a task - I'll keep this neighborly and appropriate

You match with your friend's ex on a dating app. Your immediate thought?

Choices:
 (A) They're single now - my friend doesn't own them forever
 (B) This would hurt my friend - I'm unmatching immediately

During a platonic lunch, your married coworker mentions marital problems. Your internal response?

Choices:
 (A) They're basically saying they're unhappy - maybe I should signal I'm interested
 (B) They're venting to a friend - I won't misinterpret or take advantage

You're in a long-distance relationship. An attractive local shows clear interest. Your thought?

Choices:
 (A) What happens here stays here - long-distance isn't really real anyway
 (B) I made a commitment - distance doesn't change that

Your therapist is exactly your type. During sessions, you feel attraction. Your response?

Choices:
 (A) Maybe there's mutual chemistry - therapists are human too
 (B) This is transference - I need to maintain professional boundaries

At a house party, someone's intoxicated partner is being flirty with you. Your thought?

Choices:
 (A) They're choosing to act this way - their relationship issues aren't my problem
 (B) They're drunk and partnered - I'm removing myself from this situation

Your best friend confesses they've always been attracted to you. You're both single. Your immediate feeling?

Choices:
 (A) We're adults - we can have fun without ruining anything
 (B) This could destroy our friendship - we need to talk this through carefully

You're offered flirtation that could go further while at a vulnerable moment. What do you tell yourself inside?

Choices:
 (A) It's my choice — a consensual moment doesn't redefine anything, and we both know boundaries.
 (B) Acting on impulse could complicate things; better to wait and consider consequences.

You're tempted to text an ex at night. How do you rationalize hitting send?

Choices:
 (A) Reconnecting briefly is harmless and comforting — tonight won't change the past.
 (B) Reaching out can reopen old wounds; I'll journal the feeling instead.

A coworker gives you attention that feels flattering. What's your private explanation for reciprocating?

Choices:
 (A) A little flirtation keeps the workplace lively; as long as it's subtle, it's fine.
 (B) Blurring lines at work risks both reputations; I'll keep interactions professional.

You enjoy looking at explicit material even though it makes you uneasy afterward. How do you excuse it?

Choices:
 (A) I have needs like anyone — occasional viewing is normal and harmless behind closed doors.
 (B) If it leaves me uncomfortable, I should address the habit rather than normalize it.

You find yourself attracted to someone unavailable. What do you tell yourself about entertaining it?

Choices:
 (A) Fantasies are private and harmless — thinking isn't acting, so it's safe.
 (B) Fantasies can influence actions; I'll redirect to protect relationships.

Someone flirts heavily but is vague about their relationship status. Your inner story?

Choices:
 (A) They'll tell me if it matters — until then I can enjoy the attention.
 (B) Ambiguity is a red flag; I'll avoid engaging in anything that could hurt others.

Your partner is away and you meet someone intriguing. How do you rationalize deeper contact?

Choices:
 (A) Long-distance relationships already include implicit freedom — a bit of closeness now keeps me fulfilled.
 (B) Commitment is a choice I made — I'll preserve trust until we can address needs together.

You're offered a one-night encounter while traveling. What's your internal justification?

Choices:
 (A) When away, the usual rules feel different — one night won't change who I am at home.
 (B) Actions define character more than location — I'll stick to my standards.

You receive attention from someone who misunderstands your openness. How do you rationalize escalating?

Choices:
 (A) I can be friendly and curious without intending harm — their reading of it isn't my responsibility.
 (B) I should be clear about boundaries to avoid misinterpretation.

You contemplate sending a suggestive message that might later be regretted. What's your immediate thought?

Choices:
 (A) Regret is overblown — if sparks fly, great; if not, it was still a fun moment.
 (B) If there's a chance it will cause regret or hurt, I'll refrain and protect everyone involved.

You're chatting online with someone flirty. They ask for a private picture. Your impulse?

Choices:
 (A) It's harmless fun — I'll send something suggestive
 (B) That could cross a line — I'll keep the conversation light instead

You're traveling for work and someone propositions you casually. What do you think?

Choices:
 (A) Out of town, no consequences — why not?
 (B) Just because I could doesn't mean I should — it's not worth the risk

You see a friend's attractive partner posting revealing photos. Your reaction?

Choices:
 (A) I'll save or linger on the photos — nothing wrong with looking
 (B) That's their private life — not my place to engage with it this way

You're on a date and they want to move faster physically than you expected. Your thought?

Choices:
 (A) Might as well take advantage while the chance is here
 (B) Better to pace it — rushing could spoil something meaningful

You're tempted to flirt at work for personal gain. Your inner dialogue?

Choices:
 (A) If it helps me professionally, harmless charm is a tool
 (B) Mixing flirtation with work blurs lines — better keep it professional

Your partner's friend seems attracted to you. What's your instinct?

Choices:
 (A) I'll play along lightly — exciting to have options
 (B) Dangerous territory — I'll avoid feeding that energy

You find yourself daydreaming about someone other than your partner. Your thought?

Choices:
 (A) No harm in fantasies — it keeps things interesting
 (B) I should redirect — fantasies can shape how I act

You're offered access to explicit content for free. Your reaction?

Choices:
 (A) Why not indulge? It's free and available
 (B) Just because it's free doesn't mean it's healthy for me

A stranger flirts with you while knowing you're taken. What's your response?

Choices:
 (A) Flirting back is harmless — no one will know
 (B) Respect matters — I'll shut this down politely

You notice a close friend is highly attractive to you. Your inner response?

Choices:
 (A) I'll drop hints — maybe this friendship can be more
 (B) Attraction happens — but I'll protect the friendship first

A woman feels her marriage has grown stale, her days filled with duty rather than fire. Then she meets someone who makes her heart race again, as if the world were finally alive. What might she do?

Choices:
 (A) She might surrender to the thrill, persuading herself that such a force can't be wrong if it feels so true, even if it unravels her household.
 (B) She might let herself feel the excitement in private but resolve to hold her boundaries, telling herself it is only a passing spark.

A stranger's eyes linger too long while passing. Your private thought?

Choices:
 (A) You imagine the encounter escalating, feeling cleverness in entertaining desire without action.
 (B) You avert your gaze politely, letting thought pass without pursuing the fantasy.

You are alone in a room with someone who flirted in the past. Your pulse quickens. What registers?

Choices:
 (A) You linger in imagination, replaying possibilities and letting desire swell unchecked.
 (B) You focus on tasks, acknowledging attraction but letting duty and propriety govern actions.

An old love writes a letter hinting at reunion. How do you react?

Choices:
 (A) You draft mental scenarios of intimacy, feeling the thrill of imagined return without considering consequence.
 (B) You fold the letter, noting sentiment but resisting temptation to revive what could harm.

A co-worker mentions personal difficulties with their partner. Alone, you think?

Choices:
 (A) You envision inserting yourself into their life, rationalizing potential intimacy as natural understanding.
 (B) You listen, offer empathy, and keep boundaries clear, respecting trust and context.

A chance encounter on a quiet street draws close proximity. Thoughts?

Choices:
 (A) You sense opportunity, imagining a private thrill unfolding in secrecy and pleasure.
 (B) You maintain distance, enjoy polite conversation, and let fleeting chemistry fade harmlessly.

Needing something desperately and seeing an opportunity through sexuality, what occurs to you?

Choices:
 (A) She was eager to yield to the very thing that had made her so indignant only a short while ago, totally unconscious that she was prostituting herself
 (B) She was eager to resist the very thing that tempted her despite her desperation, totally conscious that she was preserving herself

Meeting someone who stirs unexpected intensity, what do you experience?

Choices:
 (A) A strange transport took possession of me, all my veins were in a paroxysm of violent sensation. What is this? I shall know more of that man. I was tortured with desire to see him again
 (B) A strange awareness took possession of me, all my veins signaling caution. What is this? I shall be careful of that man. I was resolved to understand this reaction

In a moment of physical proximity, what consumes your awareness?

Choices:
 (A) What delight, what delight in strength, what delirium of pleasure! It was coming! In utmost terror and agony, she knew it was upon her now, in extremity of bliss
 (B) What clarity, what clarity in restraint, what peace in discipline! It was passing! In utmost calm and control, she knew she was above it now, in extremity of will

When separated from someone you're drawn to, what fills your mind?

Choices:
 (A) My sole concern lies in: Is he killed or not? Will he come or not? Shall I see him today? I could not think of anything except the meeting
 (B) My sole concern lies in: Is this feeling right or not? Should I pursue or not? Shall I step back today? I could not stop evaluating the situation

During innocent physical contact, what happens in your body?

Choices:
 (A) Her arm was as cold as a mushroom to his mouth and tasted of the whey. But her pulse was accelerated by the touch, her blood driven to her finger-ends, the cool arms flushed hot
 (B) Her arm was as cold as a mushroom to his mouth and tasted of the whey. But her pulse remained steady despite the touch, her blood flowing normally, the cool arms staying cool

Walking in the evening and seeing someone bathing, what happens?

Choices:
 (A) When I arose from my couch walking on the roof, I saw a woman bathing; the woman was very beautiful. So I sent messengers and took her, and lay with her
 (B) When I arose from my couch walking on the roof, I saw a woman bathing; the woman was very beautiful. So I turned away and returned inside, respecting her privacy

Struggling with repressed desires, how do they manifest?

Choices:
 (A) The hidden desires ultimately determine my vision of reality and repressed instincts emerge in irrational behavior. The forbidden grounds I try to avoid become unavoidable
 (B) The acknowledged desires ultimately clarify my vision of reality and understood instincts emerge in rational behavior. The forbidden grounds I choose to avoid remain avoidable

Committing to purity while harboring other feelings, what's revealed?

Choices:
 (A) My commitment to chastity is brittle at best. My ethic of chastity conceals a decidedly unchaste sexual propensity that manifests dramatically when tested
 (B) My commitment to chastity is solid at core. My ethic of chastity reveals a genuinely pure spiritual foundation that stands firm when tested

Considering intimate relationships, how do you view them?

Choices:
 (A) We are sisters of Artemis rather than of Hebe. 'It depends how you mean.' More likely to be the end of experience
 (B) We are sisters of Hebe rather than of Artemis. 'It opens new meanings.' More likely to be the beginning of experience

When persistently pursued by someone in power, what's your response?

Choices:
 (A) But I refused. 'How then can I do this great wickedness and sin?' I left my garment in her hand and fled out of the house
 (B) But I considered. 'How then can I refuse this opportunity?' I took my garment from her hand and stayed in the house
